metadata.name: Potential Reconnaissance For Cached Credentials Via Cmdkey.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects usage of cmdkey to look for cached credentials on the system

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\cmdkey.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('cmdkey.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -l')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' /l')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' –l')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' —l')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' ―l'))))

output.summary: Detects usage of cmdkey to look for cached credentials on the system

metadata.objective: Examine fields: process.cmd_line, process.parent_process.cmd_line, actor.user.name False positive: Legitimate administrative tasks References: https://www.peew.pw/blog/2017/11/26/exploring-cmdkey-an-edge-case-for-privilege-escalation, https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc754243(v=ws.11).aspx, https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/b27a3cb25025161d49ac861cb216db68c46a3537/atomics/T1003.005/T1003.005.md#atomic-test-1---cached-credential-dump-via-cmdkey
